page.title: 13Mrs Chandler of Nosterfield
page.content: My first recollection of village life was walking 1.5 miles to school around 1918.Now traffic is heavier a bus conveys the children.It was unusual for married women to go out to work except for seasonal farm work. The men were employed on farms in the village - now every able bodied person needs to find work away.Everyone helped each other in trouble,there was no pension and money was scarce. Entertainment was made in the village: skating on the pond,a village feast, sports,cricket,football and quoit matches.The village has lost it's community spirit. Children played 'fox-off','hop scotch' 'whip and top','rounders'etc., now they watch television.To hear local news you went to the smithy,shop or pub.Alas these have gone with the exception of the pub and the chapel.
